tossups.question: In 1961, this city became the new home of the Belen Jesuit Preparatory School after its previous campus was seized by the government. This city was the endpoint of the Freedom Flights, which created an “Ellis Island of the South” at Freedom Tower. In 1996, the death of two aviators working for Brothers to the Rescue caused this city to cancel its Calle Ocho [cai-yay ocho] festival. In 1980, this city processed thousands of refugees from the Mariel Boatlift. For ten points, name this city where celebrations on the death of Fidel Castro broke out in Little Havana in Florida.
